snippet: The presidential candidate Abdullah Abdullah won the endorsement of the third-place candidate, Zalmay Rassoul, for the runoff vote next month.
abstract: Abdullah Abdullah, front-runner in Afghanistan’s presidential election campaign, says he has won endorsement of third-place candidate Zalmay Rassoul as part of his effort to gather enough support to win next round of voting; support does not guarantee Abdullah's victory in next round; some analysts worry that runoff could be rife with fraud and subject to disruption by the Taliban.

byline.contributor: Jawad Sukhanyar and Haris Kakar contributed reporting from Kabul, and Taimoor Shah from Kandahar.

lead_paragraph: The presidential candidate Abdullah Abdullah won the endorsement of the third-place candidate, Zalmay Rassoul, for the runoff vote next month.

headline.main: Front-Runner in Afghan Election Secures a Key Ally
headline.print_headline: Front-Runner in Afghan Election Secures a Key Ally
